text: Arizona's 4th Legislative District is one of 30 in the state, covering parts of Pima, Maricopa, Pinal, and Yuma counties. As of 2018 there are 59 precincts in the district—23 in Yuma, 18 in Maricopa, 17 in Pima, and 1 in Pinal—with a total registered voter population of 91,864. ==Political representation== The district is represented for the 2018–2019 Legislative Session in the State Senate by Lisa Otondo (D, Yuma) and in the House of Representatives by Charlene Fernandez (D, Yuma) and Geraldine Peten (D, Goodyear). ==See also== * List of Arizona Legislative Districts * Arizona State Legislature ==References== Category:Arizona legislative districts Category:Maricopa County, Arizona Category:Yuma County, Arizona Category:Pima County, Arizona Category:Pinal County, Arizona
title: Arizona's 4th legislative district
